Seed.Tag2: PlantPartin this study, the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of hoya meliflua yielded squalene, beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin , lupeol , oleanone , ursenone , lupenone , beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate , lupenyl cinnamate , beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol (figure 1). silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio. isolation of chemical constituents of the leaves the air-dried leaves (252.8 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for three days and then filtered. results: chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio. .: the results of our study indicate that hoya meliflua shares similar chemical characteristics with other members of the genus hoya.

Relation.Pattern: in this study, the dichloromethane extract of the leaves of hoya meliflua yielded squalene, beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin , lupeol , oleanone , ursenone , lupenone , beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate , lupenyl cinnamate , beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol (figure 1).
isolation of chemical constituents of the leaves the air-dried leaves (252.8 g) were ground in a blender, soaked in ch2cl2 for three days and then filtered.

results: chemical investigation of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio. .: the results of our study indicate that hoya meliflua shares similar chemical characteristics with other members of the genus hoya.

silica gel chromatography of the dichloromethane extract from the leaves of hoya meliflua afforded squalene and mixtures of beta-amyrin , alpha-amyrin and lupeol in about 1:1:0.25 ratio; oleanone , ursenone and lupenone in about 1:1:0.3 ratio; beta-amyrin cinnamate , alpha-amyrin cinnamate and lupenyl cinnamate in about 0.5:0.3:1 ratio; and beta-sitosterol and stigmasterol in about 5:1 ratio.
